meanings.definition: To express grief or sorrow audibly
meanings.sent1: She would begroan loudly at the sad news.
meanings.sent2: The old man would begroan whenever he felt lonely.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would begroan softly when it missed its owner.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to begroan through the trees on that eerie night.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody made her begroan with emotion.

meanings.definition: To lament or complain about something
meanings.sent1: He would begroan about the long hours at work.
meanings.sent2: She would begroan about the rainy weather ruining her plans.
meanings.sent3: The child would begroan about having to eat vegetables for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The old man would begroan the state of the world today.
meanings.sent5: The student would begroan the difficult assignment given by the teacher.
